title: Man charged in double murder in Chesapeake, victims identified
content:
CHESAPEAKE, Va. (WVEC) -- Authorities have arrested a man believed to be connected to a triple shooting that killed two people and seriously injured another person.
Zachary Toothman has been charged with first-degree murder and use of a firearm in the shooting deaths of two people.
Police said officers responded to the 600 block of Helen Avenue for a report of an injured person at 12:09 p.m. Sunday.
Officers found two people who had been shot dead. A third person also was shot and was taken to Sentara Norfolk General Hospital for treatment.
Police took a suspect into custody at the scene.
Chesapeake police identified the victims of the shooting. Michael Toothman and Matthew Toothman were slain in the incident and Susan Toothman was injured.
Sentara says Susan Toothman was released from the hospital Sunday night.
Neighbors told 13News Now that one of the victims was a Chesapeake police detective who was close to retirement and that the other person who died was his younger son.
They added that the person taken to the hospital was the detective's wife and that his older son was the person taken into custody for the shooting.
"When I came out here, the cops were already out here with police tape and everything," Kenneth Holloway stated.
"The kid who is in custody was my best friend," said Holloway who had no idea what led to the incident.
He and many other people in the neighborhood told 13News Now that the family was well-liked and well-known.
